list_definition.definition: a branch etc on which a bird sits or stands

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The pigeon would not fly down from its perch.
He looked down from his perch on the roof.

list_definition.definition: (of birds) to go to (a perch); to sit or stand on (a perch)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The bird flew up and perched on the highest branch of the tree.

list_definition.definition: to put, or be, in a high seat or position

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He perched the child on his shoulder

list_ex_of_english: In plain language, the man was sitting there as a passenger carrying the perches on which the hens roost.
I see myself perched on her pink bedspread, earnestly listening to a story about two birds.
Of course perches, litter, baths and nestboxes are an improvement, but are we not once again encouraging producers to invest money which will very soon prove to have been wasted?
Individuals of these species arrived on an infested tree and perched on the upper branches.
Raptors were seen soaring above the roost, perching on trees close to roosting animals, chasing the bats on the wing and diving into the roosting trees.
At one side of the cave, but perched up on the top of the mountain it has pierced, are the ruins of a small ancient fort.
Traps were protected from perching birds by inserting nails around the frame.
Now the man is perched precariously on the top of his chimney - the only bit of his house above the raging torrent.
